title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A novel about the American dream and the moral decay of society in the 1920s.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society under constant surveillance.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about racial injustice in the Deep South during the 1930s.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel that critiques the British class system and marriage in the early 19th century.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A futuristic novel that explores a world of controlled happiness and a lack of individuality.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: The story of a teenager's struggle with alienation and the search for identity.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic fantasy novel about the journey to destroy a powerful ring and defeat an evil force.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
description: A dystopian novel where a girl must compete in a televised death match to survive.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: A whaling voyage led by Captain Ahab who is obsessed with capturing the elusive white whale.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: A society where books are banned, and a fireman is tasked with burning them.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A philosophical tale about a shepherd's journey to pursue his dreams and find his personal legend.
